info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 22 at 6:46AM CST until February 22 at 9:00PM CST by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...WINTRY PRECIPITATION CONTINUING ACROSS THE AREA... .Occasional light snow was impacting northern Wisconsin early this morning, while a light wintry mix was observed along and south of a line from Marshfield to Sturgeon Bay. The precipitation is expected to increase again during the late morning and afternoon, with mixed precipitation changing to snow in the southern and eastern parts of the forecast area during the afternoon. The snow will taper off from south to north during the late afternoon and evening. Reduced visibilities and snow or ice covered roads will result in hazardous travel conditions. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow, especially in the late morning and afternoon. Additional snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches. * WHERE...Portions of central, north central, and northeast Wisconsin. * WHEN...Until 9 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...After a lull early this morning, snow is expected to increase in coverage and intensity in the late morning and afternoon. Thundersnow may occur in parts of far northeast Wisconsin this afternoon, and may result in brief periods of heavy snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for Wisconsin can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
